text: I love me some Streets of Rage. But this box art never fails to get a laugh out of me. Look at Skate. He's just so serious for a kid fighting while wearing roller blades. I mean everyone else seems to be having a great time. But not Skate. He's getting too old for this.

author: Victor Bazin

text: This is what wakes me up every morning!
author: Shad G

text:
Wow, glad to see this on there finally. Kind of absurd though, with such a high amount of songs in the series (over 1940), you'd think great famous tracks like these have been in the playlist for years. There's a big gap between this SOR2 song and the previous one (which is number 1471), just goes to show that there's tons of video games with great soundtracks and how even with such high number of tracks you still can be missing the classics (if I can call so songs like SOR2's dreamer). 
On a bit of unrelated note, I know you've played Live-a-Live, but It's mind-boggling (to me at least) how you haven't added Megalomania as a Best VGM. It's so blood-pumping and amazing, one of my favorite video game tracks for sure.
author: Happytreefriendsfan3

text: It only took 1940 other songs until we got this. This version doesn't sound great though.

text: I have this on my virtual console. Great game! Still holds up, and its stellar soundtrack makes it even better.
author: Morgan Kim

text: SoR 1 and 2 are amazing and I can easily play through them both in one sitting. Three is still fun, but you're right, something about ti just doesn't sit right. Might be the music that was making if feel off this entire time.
author: Jared Silvestri

text: I was listening to Streets of Rage 3's soundtrack again and after all this time, I still can't enjoy it. Koshiro went with another composition method using a randomizer and it doesn't click with me. I proceeded to listen to this game's soundtrack and it felt like night and day. This is the Koshiro music I love.
author: SupraDarky

text: There are several good tracks in SoR3, in my opinion... but they're all composed by Motohiro Kawashima. I don't know what happened to Koshiro at this period, but SoR3, Beyond Oasis and Actraiser 2 are so far from what I like it's not even funny.
author: Radoslav Mitrov

text: Thankfully, he continues to write stronger stuff today.  Good ol' Etrian Odyssey has been my biggest surprise find of the last few years.

text: Streets of Rage 3's OST is not in my neighbourhood. The first two were glorious IMO. Thanks for the idea. I give it a full listen soon!
